qa_pairs.question: Where is the Office of the Controller General of Accounts located, and what historical changes have occurred in its establishment and naming over time?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>The Office of the Controller General of Accounts is located in Segunbagicha, Dhaka, Bangladesh.<cite>[S2]</cite></statement> <statement>The office was established in 1985 through an office memo of the Finance Division under the Ministry of Finance.<cite>[S4]</cite></statement> <statement>Previously, it was known as the Office of the Accountant General, which was established in 1947.<cite>[S5]</cite></statement> <statement>The name change from "Accountant General" to "Controller General of Accounts" reflects its evolving role in government financial management.<cite>[S4][S5]</cite></statement>

# Office of the Controller General of Accounts



The **Office of the Controller General of Accounts** (Bengali: হিসাব মহানিয়ন্ত্রক) is an autonomous government agency responsible for compilation and consolidation of government accounts. [S2] It is headquartered in Segunbagicha, Dhaka, Bangladesh. [S3] ## History

The Office of the Controller General of Accounts was established in 1985 through an office memo of the Finance Division under the Ministry of Finance. [S4] Before then it was known as the Office of the Accountant General which was established in 1947. [S5] It monitors the collection of taxes by the National Board of Revenue. [S6] According to a study by Transparency International Bangladesh there were 23 specific incidents of corruption in the Office of the Controller General of Accounts. [S7] The Office of the Controller General of Accounts sometimes collaborates with the Office of the Comptroller and Auditor General of Bangladesh.
